page.title: 09Piddinghoe Interviews
page.content: There are 60+ houses in this village. We gave out 50 questionaires and got 30 replies. Few villagers felt they were accepted until they had lived there for at least 10 years. In our survey we found 60%<8 20%<20 and 20%>20 yrs old. This changing population is untypical of rural villages and shows Piddinghoe becoming more of a dormitory. This is confirmed by the high mobility of the residents: 26/30 having cars. Most of those in work have to travel outside the village, many in professional or academic roles in Brighton or Lewes. New building is restricted but there has has been concentrated in-filling and development. The traditional social events are continued but it is hard to maintain the old idea of a village when there is no shop. The village is felt to occupy a pleasant position but has lost its heart.
